page.title: 14RELIGION IN DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: {METHODIST}membership is 116 with average congregations at the church on Manchester Rd.(1868) of 65(morning) and 18(evening). Av. Sunday School attendance is 25. Various mid-week meetings cater for social, cultural and devotional needs. Wortley people travel to Green Moor or Thurgoland (2 miles).{ANGLICANS}attending St.John's church, Deepcar(1877), number about 60 (Communion), 20 (evening) and 25 at Sunday School. In 1984 it became a parish in its own right. Some Deepcar people attend the original mother churches in Bolsterstone and Stocksbridge. Attached groups are the Mothers' Union, Mother & Toddler, and Brownies/Guides. St.Leonard's, Wortley (13th.C) has its own parish. The {PENTECOSTAL}church is expanding, moving from Deepcar Village Hall to Stocksbridge.
